title: Mass PRIM Aims to Boost Commitments to Private Equity
sub_head: Investment committee votes to recommend up to $3.3 billion in new commitments to private-equity funds
body:
Massachusetts’ largest public-pension fund is set to put more money toward private equity, after a year in which the asset class delivered the strongest performance of any of the fund’s investment categories.
The investment committee of the Massachusetts Pension Reserve Investment Management, or Mass PRIM, voted unanimously Tuesday on a plan to increase the fund’s target allocation to private equity by 1% while lowering its target allocation to public equities by 1%.
